messages.text:
Anati, you were right.
You are right.
I shouldn't have to hoard water containers in my yard.
I shouldn't have to tremble when my daughter passes through Arab areas, or wonder if my son isn't in a bunker because they abandon him and nobody cares.
I shouldn't have to sleep in an empty bed while my wife and kids are crammed in the safe room.
My son shouldn't have to get anxiety attacks, or nightmares because of sirens.
I shouldn't have to install bolts on the safe room so Gaza commandos can't slaughter my children.
And a motorcycle in the street shouldn't set off my fight-or-flight.
We're just peace-loving people, and we don't deserve trauma like this.
I'm ready to go back to Irvine. As crazy as it sounds, because until a month ago I was really doing well here.
But everyone was right, all the tech workers who left, it's not good here anymore. Everything's rotten. Everything.
Let's start over in California.
We can all heal there from the trauma.
Let's start planning.
